CatDescriptText: Earl Finch, 830 Adelaids Street and Booker Green, 2608 Bedford Avenue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?" Mr. Finch's answer reads: "No, they are not geting a fair deal. I think politics have a great deal to do with the bad deal we are getting."  Mr. Green's answer reads: "I know Negroes are not getting a fiar deal on the Lower hill program nor in private construction.  The work we used to do is being done by whites - with no consideration at all for Negroes."Hicks Market was burnt down during the riots of 1968
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Earl Finch and Booker Green standing in front of Hicks Superette Market, Hill District
